tasks.title: Implement Voting System Backend
tasks.description: Create the backend structure for the voting system using Supabase, including database schema and API endpoints.
tasks.details:
1. Design and implement the following tables in Supabase:
   - votes: id, title, description, start_time, end_time
   - vote_options: id, vote_id, option_text
   - user_votes: id, user_id, vote_id, vote_option_id, created_at
2. Set up Row Level Security (RLS) policies for each table to ensure data security.
3. Create API endpoints using Supabase Functions or Edge Functions for:
   - Creating a new vote
   - Submitting a vote
   - Fetching vote results
4. Implement server-side validation to prevent duplicate voting.
tasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for each API endpoint using Jest. Test RLS policies by attempting unauthorized access. Perform integration tests to ensure proper data flow between tables.

tasks.title: Implement Comprehensive Error Handling
tasks.description: Develop a robust error handling system for both frontend and backend operations.
tasks.details:
1. Create a centralized error handling utility for API requests.
2. Implement custom error classes for different types of errors (network, validation, etc.).
3. Add error boundaries to React components to catch and display runtime errors.
4. Create user-friendly error messages for common error scenarios.
5. Implement logging of errors to a backend service for monitoring.
6. Add retry logic for transient errors, especially in real-time connections.
7. Ensure all async operations are properly wrapped in try-catch blocks.
8. Create a global error state in Zustand for managing application-wide errors.
tasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for error handling utilities. Create integration tests that simulate various error scenarios. Perform end-to-end tests to verify error messages are displayed correctly to users.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement Centralized Error Utility Module
subtasks.description: Create a centralized error utility module to standardize error handling across the application. This module should include utility functions for error formatting, categorization, and propagation.
subtasks.details: Develop a TypeScript module in the shared utils directory. Ensure it can be imported both in frontend and backend code. Include functions for formatting error messages, mapping error codes, and optionally integrating with logging services.

subtasks.title: Define and Implement Custom Error Classes
subtasks.description: Develop custom error classes (e.g., AuthError, ValidationError, ApiError) that extend the native Error object, providing additional context and metadata.
subtasks.details: Implement these classes in TypeScript, ensuring they are compatible with both server and client environments. Integrate them with the centralized error utility for consistent usage.

subtasks.title: Integrate React Error Boundaries Using Next.js App Router
subtasks.description: Set up error boundaries at appropriate route segments using Next.js 13+ App Router conventions (error.js files) to catch and isolate errors in the UI.
subtasks.details: Create error.js files in relevant app route segments. Implement error boundary components that display user-friendly messages and provide recovery options (e.g., retry button). Ensure error boundaries report errors to the centralized utility.

subtasks.title: Implement User-Facing Error Messaging Components
subtasks.description: Develop reusable UI components for displaying error messages to users, ensuring clarity and actionable feedback.
subtasks.details: Use Tailwind CSS to style error alerts, modals, or banners. Ensure messages are specific and helpful, avoiding generic text. Integrate with error boundaries and async error handlers.

subtasks.title: Set Up Backend Error Logging and Monitoring
subtasks.description: Implement backend error logging using Supabase functions or third-party services. Ensure all critical errors are logged with sufficient context for debugging.
subtasks.details: Integrate logging in API routes and server actions. Optionally connect to external monitoring tools for alerting and analytics. Ensure logs include error type, stack trace, and user/session context where possible.

subtasks.title: Add Retry Logic for Recoverable Errors
subtasks.description: Implement retry mechanisms for transient errors (e.g., network failures) in both frontend data fetching and backend API calls.
subtasks.details: Use the reset function in error boundaries for UI retries. For async operations, implement exponential backoff or limited retries. Ensure retries are tracked and do not cause infinite loops.

subtasks.title: Enhance Async Error Handling in Data Fetching and Actions
subtasks.description: Standardize async error handling in React components, server actions, and API routes using the centralized utility and custom error classes.
subtasks.details: Refactor existing async code to use try/catch where appropriate, returning or throwing custom errors. Ensure all async errors are surfaced to error boundaries or logged as needed.

subtasks.title: Implement Global Error State Management
subtasks.description: Establish a global error state using React context or a state management library to track and respond to errors across the application.
subtasks.details: Create a context provider for error state. Allow components to set, clear, and subscribe to global errors. Integrate with error boundaries and user messaging components for seamless UX.

tasks.title: Optimize Application Performance
tasks.description: Implement performance optimizations including code splitting, lazy loading, and caching strategies.
tasks.details:
1. Implement code splitting using Next.js dynamic imports for large components.
2. Set up lazy loading for images and components below the fold.
3. Optimize Tailwind CSS by purging unused styles in production builds.
4. Implement caching strategies for API responses using SWR or React Query.
5. Use Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) for semi-static pages.
6. Optimize fonts by using next/font for better loading performance.
7. Implement service worker for offline support and faster subsequent page loads.
8. Use React.memo and useMemo to optimize expensive computations and rerenders.
tasks.testStrategy: Use Lighthouse and WebPageTest for performance benchmarking. Create performance budgets and automated tests to prevent performance regressions. Test the application performance on various devices and network conditions.

subtasks.title: Analyze Current Application Structure and Performance Bottlenecks
subtasks.description: Review the existing Picnic web application to identify areas for improvement in code splitting, lazy loading, Tailwind usage, API calls, ISR, font loading, service worker setup, and React performance.
subtasks.details: Use profiling tools and Next.js analytics to pinpoint slow-loading pages, large bundles, and inefficient rendering patterns.

subtasks.title: Implement Code Splitting and Lazy Loading
subtasks.description: Refactor the application to leverage dynamic imports and React Suspense for components and routes that are not needed on initial load.
subtasks.details: Use Next.js dynamic imports and ensure only critical code is loaded upfront. Apply lazy loading to images and non-critical components.

subtasks.title: Optimize Tailwind CSS Usage
subtasks.description: Configure Tailwind CSS to purge unused styles and minimize the final CSS bundle size.
subtasks.details: Update tailwind.config.js to enable JIT mode and ensure only used classes are included in production builds.

subtasks.title: Set Up API Caching Strategies
subtasks.description: Implement server-side and client-side caching for API requests to reduce redundant network calls and improve perceived performance.
subtasks.details: Use SWR or React Query for client-side caching and HTTP cache headers or Supabase edge functions for server-side caching.

subtasks.title: Configure Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR)
subtasks.description: Enable ISR for pages that can benefit from static generation with periodic revalidation to balance freshness and performance.
subtasks.details: Update Next.js page configurations to use revalidate options and test regeneration behavior for dynamic content.

subtasks.title: Optimize Font Loading
subtasks.description: Switch to using next/font for local font hosting and configure font-display: swap to prevent layout shifts and blocking renders.
subtasks.details: Audit current font usage, preload critical fonts, and defer non-essential fonts as needed.

subtasks.title: Implement Service Worker for Offline Support and Asset Caching
subtasks.description: Add a service worker to cache static assets and API responses, enabling offline access and faster repeat visits.
subtasks.details: Use Workbox or Next.js PWA plugins to register and configure the service worker, ensuring compatibility with App Router.

subtasks.title: Tune React and Next.js Performance
subtasks.description: Apply React and Next.js best practices such as memoization, avoiding unnecessary re-renders, and optimizing component structure.
subtasks.details: Use React.memo, useCallback, and useMemo where appropriate; audit component tree for heavy renders; leverage Next.js built-in optimizations.

tasks.title: Enhance Security Measures
tasks.description: Implement additional security features to protect user data and prevent common vulnerabilities.
tasks.details:
1. Implement proper CORS settings in Supabase to restrict API access.
2. Set up Content Security Policy (CSP) headers to prevent XSS attacks.
3. Use HttpOnly cookies for storing authentication tokens.
4. Implement rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent abuse.
5. Use Supabase RLS policies to ensure data access is properly restricted.
6. Implement input sanitization on both frontend and backend.
7. Set up security headers including X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, etc.
8. Regularly update dependencies to patch known vulnerabilities.
9. Implement two-factor authentication option for user accounts.
tasks.testStrategy: Perform security audits using tools like OWASP ZAP. Conduct penetration testing to identify potential vulnerabilities. Write unit tests for security-related functions like input sanitization.

subtasks.title: Configure CORS Policy in Next.js App Router
subtasks.description: Set up and enforce Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for all API endpoints and route handlers to restrict allowed origins and HTTP methods.
subtasks.details: Review all custom route handlers (route.ts) and API endpoints. Use appropriate CORS middleware or headers to allow only trusted origins, especially for endpoints handling authentication or sensitive data.

subtasks.title: Implement Content Security Policy (CSP) Headers
subtasks.description: Define and apply a strict Content Security Policy via HTTP headers to mitigate XSS and data injection attacks.
subtasks.details: Configure the Content-Security-Policy header in the Next.js custom server or via middleware. Specify allowed sources for scripts, styles, images, and other resources. Test the policy in development and staging environments to avoid breaking legitimate functionality.

subtasks.title: Set HttpOnly and Secure Flags on Authentication Cookies
subtasks.description: Ensure all authentication and session cookies are set with HttpOnly and Secure flags to prevent client-side access and transmission over insecure channels.
subtasks.details: Audit cookie usage in Supabase auth integration and any custom session management. Update cookie settings in API route handlers and middleware to include HttpOnly and Secure attributes.

subtasks.title: Integrate Rate Limiting for API Endpoints
subtasks.description: Apply rate limiting to all public-facing API endpoints and authentication routes to prevent abuse and brute-force attacks.
subtasks.details: Select a rate limiting middleware compatible with Next.js App Router (e.g., using edge middleware or serverless functions). Configure limits based on endpoint sensitivity and expected usage patterns.

subtasks.title: Define and Enforce Row-Level Security (RLS) Policies in Supabase
subtasks.description: Audit and implement RLS policies for all relevant tables in Supabase to ensure users can only access their own data.
subtasks.details: Review current Supabase schema and authentication logic. Write and test RLS policies for each table, ensuring proper enforcement for both read and write operations.

subtasks.title: Implement Input Sanitization and Validation
subtasks.description: Sanitize and validate all user input on both client and server sides to prevent injection attacks and malformed data.
subtasks.details: Use libraries such as zod or yup for TypeScript-based validation. Apply input checks in server actions, API routes, and Supabase queries. Ensure error handling for invalid input.

subtasks.title: Set Additional Security Headers
subtasks.description: Add and configure security-related HTTP headers such as X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, and Referrer-Policy.
subtasks.details: Update Next.js custom server or middleware to include these headers in all responses. Test for compatibility with frontend features and third-party integrations.

subtasks.title: Automate Dependency Updates and Security Audits
subtasks.description: Set up automated tools to regularly check for and apply security updates to dependencies.
subtasks.details: Integrate tools like Dependabot or Renovate for npm packages. Schedule regular security audits using npm audit or similar tools, and review update logs for breaking changes.

subtasks.title: Implement Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) for User Accounts
subtasks.description: Add support for two-factor authentication in the authentication flow, leveraging Supabase or a compatible third-party provider.
subtasks.details: Design the 2FA flow (e.g., TOTP, SMS, or email-based). Update authentication UI and backend logic to support 2FA enrollment, verification, and recovery. Ensure compatibility with existing WeChat login integration.

tasks.title: Implement Comprehensive Testing Suite
tasks.description: Develop and implement a full testing strategy including unit, integration, and end-to-end tests.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Jest and React Testing Library for unit and integration tests.
2. Implement Cypress for end-to-end testing.
3. Create unit tests for all utility functions and hooks.
4. Write integration tests for complex component interactions.
5. Develop end-to-end tests for critical user flows like voting and authentication.
6. Implement visual regression testing using tools like Percy.
7. Set up CI/CD pipeline to run tests automatically on each commit.
8. Create mocks for external services and APIs to enable isolated testing.
9. Implement test coverage reporting and set minimum coverage thresholds.
10. Develop tests for different locales to ensure proper internationalization.
tasks.testStrategy: Aim for high test coverage, especially for critical paths. Regularly review and update tests as new features are added. Incorporate testing into the development workflow to catch issues early.

subtasks.title: Set up Jest and React Testing Library for unit testing
subtasks.description: Configure Jest and React Testing Library to work with Next.js 13+ App Router, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS
subtasks.details: Install required packages (jest, @testing-library/react, @testing-library/jest-dom, jest-environment-jsdom). Create jest.config.js with proper Next.js 13 configuration. Set up test scripts in package.json. Create a basic test setup file that includes necessary mocks for Next.js features.

subtasks.title: Implement API route testing framework
subtasks.description: Create testing utilities for Next.js 13+ App Router API routes with Supabase integration
subtasks.details: Set up mocks for NextResponse and NextRequest. Create utility functions to simulate API requests. Implement Supabase client mocking strategy. Create example tests for GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE routes that interact with Supabase.

subtasks.title: Set up Playwright for end-to-end testing
subtasks.description: Configure Playwright to test user flows in the application including WeChat login integration
subtasks.details: Install Playwright and configure it for the project. Create test directory structure. Set up environment variables for testing. Implement mock for WeChat login API for testing purposes. Create basic page object models for main application pages.

subtasks.title: Implement component testing strategy
subtasks.description: Create reusable testing patterns for UI components with Tailwind CSS
subtasks.details: Set up component testing utilities. Create snapshot testing configuration. Implement tests for basic UI components. Create testing helpers for Tailwind CSS class verification. Set up accessibility testing with axe-core.

subtasks.title: Develop custom hook testing framework
subtasks.description: Create utilities for testing custom React hooks in the application
subtasks.details: Set up @testing-library/react-hooks or equivalent for Next.js 13+. Create mock providers for context-dependent hooks. Implement tests for authentication hooks that interact with Supabase. Create tests for data fetching hooks.

subtasks.title: Implement Supabase mocking strategy
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive mocks for Supabase client and services
subtasks.details: Create mock implementation of Supabase client. Set up test fixtures for database responses. Implement authentication mocks. Create utility functions to simulate Supabase errors and edge cases.

subtasks.title: Set up visual regression testing
subtasks.description: Implement visual regression testing using Playwright or a dedicated tool
subtasks.details: Research and select appropriate visual regression testing tool compatible with Next.js 13+. Configure screenshot comparison settings. Create baseline screenshots for key pages. Implement tests for responsive design across different viewport sizes.

subtasks.title: Configure CI/CD integration for tests
subtasks.description: Set up GitHub Actions or other CI/CD pipeline to run tests automatically
subtasks.details: Create CI workflow configuration files. Set up caching for faster test runs. Configure test reporting and artifacts. Implement parallel test execution for faster feedback. Set up failure notifications.

## Database Structure
### Authentication Schema (auth)
- **auth.users**: Supabase default user table (UUID-based ID)
- **auth.sessions**: User session management
- **auth.identities**: Social login integration information

### Application Schema (public)
- **user_profiles**: User profile information (using auth.users ID as FK)
  - id: string (connected to auth.users.id)
  - email, nickname, avatar_url, is_admin, etc.
  - star_candy, star_candy_bonus (voting points)

### Voting-Related Tables
- **vote**: Voting events (title, start/end time, region, category, etc.)
- **vote_item**: Voting options (including artist/group information)
- **vote_pick**: User's actual voting records (user_id, vote_item_id, amount)
- **vote_comment**: Vote comments
- **vote_comment_like**: Comment likes
- **vote_comment_report**: Comment reports

### Additional Tables
- **artist**, **artist_group**: Artist and group information
- **reward**, **vote_reward**: Reward system
- **user_blocks**: User blocking functionality

## User Role Identification
1. **Regular Users**
   - user_profiles.is_admin = false
   - Can participate in voting, write comments, like
   - Should only see their own voting records

2. **Admins**
   - user_profiles.is_admin = true
   - Vote management, user management, system-wide permissions

3. **Anonymous Users**
   - Limited access to voting results only
   - Cannot participate in voting or access personal information

## Data Access Requirements
- Users can only view/modify their own vote_pick records
- Comment authors can only modify/delete their own comments
- Admins have access to all data
- Sensitive information in user_profiles (star_candy, etc.) is only accessible to the owner

# RLS Policy Rules Detailed Definition:

## 1. user_profiles Table RLS Policy

### Read Permissions (SELECT)
- **Own Profile**: `auth.uid() = id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`
- **Public Fields**: Some fields are visible to all authenticated users (nickname, avatar_url)

### Write Permissions (INSERT/UPDATE)
- **Own Profile**: `auth.uid() = id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

### Delete Permissions (DELETE)
- **Administrators Only**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

## 2. vote_pick Table RLS Policy

### Read Permissions (SELECT)
- **Own Votes**: `auth.uid() = user_id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

### Write Permissions (INSERT/UPDATE)
- **Own Votes**: `auth.uid() = user_id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

### Delete Permissions (DELETE)
- **Own Votes**: `auth.uid() = user_id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

## 3. vote_comment Table RLS Policy

### Read Permissions (SELECT)
- **All Authenticated Users**: `auth.uid() IS NOT NULL AND deleted_at IS NULL`

### Write Permissions (INSERT)
- **Authenticated Users**: `auth.uid() IS NOT NULL`

### Update Permissions (UPDATE)
- **Comment Author**: `auth.uid()::text = user_id::text`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

### Delete Permissions (DELETE)
- **Comment Author**: `auth.uid()::text = user_id::text`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

## 4. vote_comment_like Table RLS Policy

### Read Permissions (SELECT)
- **All Authenticated Users**: `auth.uid() IS NOT NULL`

### Write Permissions (INSERT/DELETE)
- **Own Likes**: `auth.uid()::text = user_id::text`

## 5. vote, vote_item, artist, artist_group Tables RLS Policy

### Read Permissions (SELECT)
- **All Users**: `deleted_at IS NULL` (public information)

### Write Permissions (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE)
- **Administrators Only**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

## 6. vote_share_bonus Table RLS Policy

### Read/Write Permissions
- **Own Bonuses**: `auth.uid() = user_id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

## 7. user_blocks Table RLS Policy

### Read/Write Permissions
- **Own Block List**: `auth.uid() = user_id`
- **Administrators**: `(SELECT is_admin FROM user_profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) = true`

tasks.title: Improve Login and Redirect Flow
tasks.description: Modify and enhance the login redirect flow to ensure users are properly redirected back to their original page (e.g., voting detail page) after successful login.
tasks.details:
1. Review and debug the current login flow:
   - Analyze the AuthRedirectHandler component
   - Check the implementation of redirect URL storage and retrieval
   - Verify session storage (sessionStorage/localStorage) functionality

2. Implement a robust redirect URL storage mechanism:
   - Store the current URL before redirecting to login page
   - Use sessionStorage to persist the redirect URL across page reloads
   - Implement encryption for stored URLs to prevent tampering

3. Modify the login page to handle redirect URLs:
   - Extract the redirect URL from sessionStorage on login page load
   - Pass the redirect URL to the authentication process

4. Update the authentication process:
   - After successful login, retrieve the stored redirect URL
   - Implement a fallback mechanism if no redirect URL is found (e.g., redirect to home page)

5. Implement automatic redirect after successful login:
   - Use React Router for client-side redirection
   - Implement a loading state during the redirect process

6. Enhance error handling:
   - Create specific error messages for different failure scenarios
   - Implement proper error logging for debugging purposes

7. Optimize for various scenarios:
   - Handle cases where the redirect URL is no longer valid
   - Implement a maximum redirect chain length to prevent infinite loops

8. Improve user experience:
   - Add a progress indicator during the login and redirect process
   - Implement smooth transitions between pages

9. Ensure cross-browser compatibility:
   - Test the redirect flow in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
   - Verify functionality on both desktop and mobile devices

10. Implement security measures:
    - Validate and sanitize redirect URLs to prevent open redirect vulnerabilities
    - Use HTTPS for all redirects to ensure secure communication

11. Update relevant components:
    - Modify the login dialog component to work with the new redirect flow
    - Update any components that trigger the login process to use the new mechanism

12. Document the new login and redirect flow for future reference and maintenance.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit Tests:
   - Write tests for URL storage and retrieval functions
   - Test encryption and decryption of stored redirect URLs
   - Verify proper handling of edge cases (e.g., missing redirect URL, invalid URL)

2. Integration Tests:
   - Test the entire login flow from multiple entry points (e.g., voting page, profile page)
   - Verify that the AuthRedirectHandler correctly manages the redirect process
   - Test login functionality with and without stored redirect URLs

3. End-to-End Tests:
   - Create test scenarios covering the complete user journey:
     a. User attempts to vote without being logged in
     b. User is presented with login dialog
     c. User completes login process
     d. User is redirected back to the voting page
   - Test the flow on different browsers and devices

4. Security Tests:
   - Attempt to inject malicious redirect URLs to check for vulnerabilities
   - Verify that all redirects use HTTPS
   - Test for potential session fixation or session hijacking vulnerabilities

5. Performance Tests:
   - Measure the time taken for the entire login and redirect process
   - Test the system under load to ensure redirect mechanism works with many concurrent users

6. User Acceptance Testing:
   - Conduct usability tests with real users to gather feedback on the login and redirect experience
   - Verify that the flow feels intuitive and smooth from a user's perspective

7. Regression Testing:
   - Ensure that the new implementation doesn't break existing functionality
   - Verify that other parts of the application still work correctly after login

8. Error Handling Tests:
   - Simulate various error conditions (e.g., network issues, server errors) to test error handling
   - Verify that appropriate error messages are displayed to the user

9. Accessibility Testing:
   - Ensure that the login and redirect process is accessible to users with disabilities
   - Test with screen readers and keyboard navigation

10. Cross-browser and Cross-device Testing:
    - Verify the login and redirect flow on different browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
    - Test on various devices (desktop, tablet, mobile) and operating systems

tasks.title: Fix Voting Dialog Display for Logged Out Users
tasks.description: Resolve the issue where the voting dialog is displayed to logged-out users due to incomplete clearing of authentication-related local data upon logout.
tasks.details:
1. Identify all locations where authentication data is stored locally:
   - Review localStorage, sessionStorage, and any other client-side storage mechanisms
   - Check for any authentication tokens or user data stored in memory (e.g., React context, Redux store)

2. Implement a comprehensive logout function:
   - Clear all authentication-related data from localStorage and sessionStorage
   - Reset any in-memory authentication state (e.g., in React context or Redux store)
   - Invalidate and remove any authentication tokens
   - Consider implementing a logout API endpoint to invalidate sessions server-side

3. Update the AuthRedirectHandler component:
   - Ensure it properly checks the current authentication state before allowing access to protected routes
   - Implement a check to verify if the user is truly logged out before displaying the voting dialog

4. Modify the voting dialog display logic:
   - Before showing the voting dialog, implement a robust check for user authentication status
   - If the user is not authenticated, redirect to the login page or show the "Login Required" dialog

5. Implement a periodic authentication state verification:
   - Create a function to verify the validity of stored authentication data
   - Set up an interval to run this check periodically (e.g., every 5 minutes or on each major user action)
   - If invalid auth state is detected, force a logout and clear all related data

6. Update error handling for API calls:
   - Implement proper error handling for 401 (Unauthorized) responses
   - On receiving a 401 error, clear local auth data and redirect to login page

7. Review and update the Row-Level Security (RLS) policies:
   - Ensure RLS policies are correctly set up to prevent unauthorized access to voting data
   - Test RLS policies thoroughly to confirm they're working as expected

8. Implement proper state management for authentication:
   - Consider using a dedicated state management solution (e.g., Redux, MobX) for handling authentication state
   - Ensure that the authentication state is consistently updated across the application

9. Add logging for authentication-related actions:
   - Implement detailed logging for login, logout, and authentication check processes
   - Use these logs to help diagnose any future authentication issues
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit Tests:
   - Write unit tests for the logout function to ensure all authentication data is properly cleared
   - Create tests for the AuthRedirectHandler to verify it correctly handles various authentication states
   - Develop tests for the voting dialog display logic to confirm it only shows for authenticated users

2. Integration Tests:
   - Implement integration tests that simulate the login-logout flow and verify that no residual auth data remains
   - Test the interaction between the authentication state and the voting dialog display

3. End-to-End Tests:
   - Create E2E tests using a tool like Cypress or Playwright to simulate user scenarios:
     a. Log in, then log out, and attempt to access the voting dialog
     b. Log out and try to directly navigate to a protected route
     c. Test the application behavior when authentication tokens expire

4. Manual Testing:
   - Perform manual testing of the logout process across different browsers and devices
   - Attempt to access protected routes and voting functionality after logout
   - Test edge cases such as:
     a. Closing the browser without logging out and then reopening
     b. Logging out in one tab while the application is open in another
     c. Testing behavior when network connectivity is lost during login/logout processes

5. Security Testing:
   - Conduct penetration testing to ensure that logged-out users cannot access protected resources
   - Verify that authentication tokens are properly invalidated upon logout

6. Performance Testing:
   - Measure the impact of the new authentication checks on application performance
   - Ensure that periodic authentication checks do not significantly impact user experience

7. Compatibility Testing:
   - Test the solution across different browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) and versions
   - Verify functionality on both desktop and mobile devices

8. Logging and Monitoring:
   - Review logs to ensure that authentication-related actions are properly recorded
   - Set up alerts for any unusual authentication patterns or errors

9. User Acceptance Testing:
   - Have a group of users test the new implementation to ensure it doesn't negatively impact the user experience
   - Gather feedback on the login/logout process and make adjustments as necessary
